uk.gov.nationalarchives.droid.signatureFile
Class ByteSeqSpecifier

java.lang.Object
  uk.gov.nationalarchives.droid.signatureFile.ByteSeqSpecifier

public class ByteSeqSpecifier
extends Object

Defines the permissible values to be taken by a specific sequence of bytes. For example, it might specify that two bytes in succession must be between 8080 and 808F (inclusive)

Author:
Richard Gault, Tessella

public ByteSeqSpecifier(StringBuffer asciiRep)
                 throws Exception
Creates a new instance of ByteSeqSpecifier

Parameters:
asciiRep - A StringBuffer whose initial portion will be an ASCII representation of the bytes specifier. This will be altered so that this initial portion is removed.
Throws:
Exception
Method Detail

getNumBytes

public int getNumBytes()

matchesByteSequence

public boolean matchesByteSequence(ByteReader file,
                                   long startPos,
                                   int direction,
                                   boolean bigEndian)
Determines whether or not a given portion of a binary file matches the sequence of bytes we specify.

Parameters:
file - The file we're currently testing
startPos - The position of the first byte in the file to examine
direction - +1 (left to right) or -1 (right to left). The overall direction which our caller is searching in
bigEndian - True iff the signature we are matching is big-endian
Returns:
true iff the portion matches

Note: In an ideal world, we would hold bigEndian as a private member, set up on construction. However, the framework used during parsing of the XML file does not lend itself to easily fetching information from a grandparent element. Consequently, we parse the byte sequence specifier in ignorance of its endianness, and wait until we try to match against a specific byte sequence (here) to find out how minSeq and maxSeq should be interpreted.
